Description: Rim and bowl sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lidless lekanis; interior and top of rim glazed streaky black; exterior, black-figure decoration (much effaced) consisting of, from left, part of palmette, with incised cross-hatch pattern and upper parts of two women confronted with added red on garments; incised blob rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: On issues regarding dating, see Möller 2000, 226 (Polos Painter and his Circle). Venit writes that the sherd joins British Museum 1914,0317.9, but it does not; however, they do probably belong to the same vase.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 334, no. B390)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 151, note 67, no. 2)
ABV / Attic Black-Figure Vase-Painters (p. 46, no. 78) ((1914,0317.9), sherds do not join.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0768) (Phase 1)
